SciTK

Class Plot

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • SciTK.SciTK_Frame
                • SciTK.Plot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.datatransfer.ClipboardOwner, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlotXY, PlotXYError, PlotXYLine, PlotXYStep, PlotXYZBlock

    public abstract class Plot
extends SciTK_Frame
implements java.awt.datatransfer.ClipboardOwner
    A class which uses Java swing to make a generic window for JFreeChart plots. Implement somes generic UI and useful methods. Various types of plots should extend this class
    Author:
    Alex Zylstra
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • exportChartAsSVG

        protected void exportChartAsSVG(org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart chart,
                    java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
                    java.io.File svgFile)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Exports a JFreeChart to a SVG file using Apache Batik library.
        Parameters:
        chart - JFreeChart to export
        bounds - the dimensions of the viewport
        svgFile - the output file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if writing the svgFile fails.

      • exportChartAsPS

        protected void exportChartAsPS(org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart chart,
                   java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
                   java.io.File psFile,
                   java.lang.String mode)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Exports a JFreeChart to a PS file using Adobe XML graphics library.
        Parameters:
        chart - JFreeChart to export
        bounds - the dimensions of the viewport
        psFile - the output file.
        mode - the file write mode ("ps","eps")
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if writing the file fails.
